intro: Serjania cuspidata, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its bark is smooth and grayish. Serjania cuspidata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
